column2: happydc, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am 52 and started having hot flashes and flushing red face, about 10 a day and 3-5 at night, wasn't sleeping, appeared tired.  After two weeks on generic EEMT HS plus provera, I was down to 1-2 hot flashes per day, now after 2 months none.  They were ruining my life, plus vaginal dryness is gone, sex drive is great, mood swings have diminished as well, I thought I was going crazy when this all started, crying for no reason.  I went with my OB/GYN recommendation and this seems to be working.  My complexion has worsened, always been a problem, but now is like in my teens.  Will discuss during my next appt and see if there is anything he can adjust.  Overall I would stay on it regardless, it has helped tremendously.

column2: barbara, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: Very valuable to replace estrogen and testosterone when ovaries are removed.

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: Hot flashes have stopped, vagina is mosit, my skin appears youthful.  All good results.

column2: hotmomma, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: The only problem I have with this drug is it's cost.  The drug does manage my symptoms wonderfully well but hits my budget pretty hard.  When I started taking this med it was around $20.00 for the generic and now it is $55.00, quite a jump.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: Because I could not take straight estrogen I tried the Estratest HS and have until they stoped making it took it for about 15 to 18 years and have never been happier with any drug. My general wellbeing was great probably, better than great. I have taken the drug that was put out to replace Estratest HS and have never felt like I did before. I have even considered having the drug made for me at a compounding pharmacy but I am sure I could not afford it.

column2: nrslinda@gmail.com, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I was told they quit manufacturing this medication, so I started taking just estrogen.  I started the hot flashes/night sweats again.  I also started hurting all over, tired, hopeless feelings, no sex drive, weight gain, hands and feet swelling.  Good news I just had my prescription filled 4/20/2010.  I did not look to see who the manufacture was, just happy to be able to get medication.  Insurance plan does not cover.  I used to get it through WalMart generic drug plan, they have taken it off their retal list.  I am going to see about their home delivery plan, it is still listed on their generic plan.  I paid $23.00 for 30 days without insurance.  It is worth the money to feel like I can move, think, remember day to day activites.

column2: Louise, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Relieves menopausal symptoms: hot flashes, low libido

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: this treatment is awsome.  I love drugs.

column2: Dr. Mika, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I had a complete hysterectomy 7 years ago. Before I even left the operating room my gynecologist had put a estrogen patch onme. Now I take a minut dose of Estratest. It has esterified estrogen and methyltestosterone in it. I take 1/4 tablet Monday through Friday. I dont have any side effects that I'm aware of. I try to take the smallest dose possible to relieve any symptoms. I tried other brands just to suffer with "hot flashes from HELL"!! I haven't had any problems in 7 years. And on the plus side, I still have a wonderful sex drive.

column2: gerrymc, 65-74 on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: This drug has given me more energy and the menopausal signs are gone.

column2: estratest(dark green), 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: given to me after surgery. have taken since about 1968,tried to stop taking and almost had heart failure!!

column2: INFO HELPER, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: THEY HAVE BEEN MAKING GENERICS FOR ESTRATEST SINCE 2006. THE DOCTOR CAN WRITE A Rx FOR ESTRATEST AND YOU'LL ASK THE PHARMACY FOR THE GENERIC BUT ALL GENERICS ARE NOT THE SAME. "ESTROGENMTEST" MADE BY "GLENMARK" IS ONLY $27.00 FOR A THREE MONTH SUPPLY (WITHOUT INSURANCE) AT WALMART WHICH IS MUCH CHEAPER AND IS EXACTLY THE SAME AS ESTRATEST. YOU'LL HAVE TO WATCH SOME PHARMACIES THOUGH. THEY BUY THE CHEAPEST GENERIC AVAILABLE TO DISPENCE AND THAT MAY CHANGE FROM MONTH TO MONTH. SO, ONCE YOU HAVE THE "TRUE" ESTRATEST GENERIC (IT LOOKS IDENTICAL TO ESTRATEST) TELL THE PHARMACY YOU WANT ONLY THAT MANUFACTURER. THEY MAY HAVE TO ORDER IT SPECIFICALLY FOR YOU BUT DOESN'T COST ANY MORE. I HOPE THIS HELPS SOME OF YOU AS I'VE ALREADY BEEN THROUGH WHAT YOU'RE FACING. GOOD LUCK!

column2: fourstyle, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Estratest for 7 years.  I tried the generic for 2 months and it was not effective at all. My hot flashes were horrible. If anyone has use something that works as well as the Estratest please help.

column2: Jersey girl, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I had a complete hysterectomy over 15 years ago. I started taking estratest full strength. I suffered no ill effects. At the advice of my doctor, I tried to taper off about 3 years ago. I could not remember simple things and started to wake up clammy. I started back on the h.s. and have never felt better. My doctor tried and had the same results. We both tried and stayed with h.s. I have a scheduled checkup in two months. I do not know what to try. Please help...

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: Used for over 10 years and felt so good...Took myself off for 4 mos... can't sleep through the night, hot flushes, uncomfortable, what is the alternative...?

column2: Kim, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: For Luna Azure. If you have Medicare you should also have Medicare Part D prescription coverage or some other creditable coverage and you can go to www.medicare.gov to enter your prescriptions and find a Part D plan that will cover this and any other medications.  I also take Estratest and found out they are no longer making it and have now started Premarin (only 1 day into it) so we'll see.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have been taking estratest for 13 years  and it has been very effective.  Today, I found out that Solvay is no longer producing estratest.  I don't know how I will do without it.  Does anyone know of something else that works as well?

column2: 75 or over Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: complete hysterectomy at 53- ovarian cancer, doctor put me on low dose estrogen immediately even though tumor was estrogen sensitive.  In 1993 or 1994 was given estratest by gynecologist - extremely helpful for increased energy, vitality improved sex drive,maintaining moisture in skin .... now am told they are no longer manufacturing this product.. have asked for replacement from doctor ... anyone have any suggestions?mkabaker@nccray.com

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I had a hysterectomy 15 years ago and Estratest kept my night sweats and hot flashes away.

column2: mlage2210@aol.com, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been very happy with estratest.  I just got the generic and did have a strong reaction.  I am nauceous and clamy. I still have a few of the original pill but am not sure what I will do when I'm out.  I was lucky because I had a partial hysterectomy at 32 and did not need any HS therapy till 55.  But when the symtoms hit I felt so horrible.  The estratest has given me back my life.

column2: LoriB, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on this for years and it works wonderfully.  Just found out Solvay quit making in 3-31-09.  I had been through several until I found this.  I don't know where to start looking for or if there is a replacement.  I don't know about you, bu I hate being a Guinea Pig. I would pay more than try a generic since one of the posts said they don't work as well.  I suppose we don't have a choice now.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
kassie, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I had a partial hysterectomy at age 42 (uterus + cervic removed).  I am now 55.  I started taking estratest HS after my surgery due to hot flashes / mood swings.  My doctor wanted me to try to go off of this drug.  I did take myself off of it gradually, and was off of it completely for 3 months.  My night + day sweats, mood swings, no sex drive etc. all returned.  Plus my joints began hurting also.  I went back on the medication a couple of months ago.  I feel like a new women again.  I guess I'll try again in a few years and see how it works out for me.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
betj52@aol.com,  Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: My side effects of menopause are less severe. I've been having a heavingness feeling in my chest. Also mild angina that stopped after I took a nitro. I'm also prescribed toprol.

column2: robyn0220, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I had a hysterectomy when I was 21. No one could get my hormones right, I started this medicine and it was incredible! Within a week I was noticing a difference. The generic version does not work as well at all! I take Estratest 1.25, the highest you can take. I have been taking it for 18 years now. NO side effects. Nothing but keeping me in a normal lifestyle (both physical and mental).If you have any questions or want to speak to me you can email me anytime! (robyn0220@gmail.com)

column2: carol, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I had a partial hysterectomy at age 29.  No doctor has EVER been able to tell me if I will go thru the change; however, it is obvious that I have been going thru it for years by my symptoms...nervousness,restlessness, depression ( which I have been able to overcome by exercising and keeping myself busy).  What does anyone have to say about "if I will go thru the change" like everyone else..PLEASE help me understand..Carol

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
ssm1020, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: i had a total hystrictomry when i was 28 and i am now 62, so i went through what they call surgical memapause it has been rough. espacilly the last three years. i lost my sex drive three years ago and  i just started my meds today and will keep you   posted on what it does for me. stay tuned.haven't been on it long enough to tell if it's going to work or now keep your fingers crossed.

column2: Luna Azure, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I used Estratest during menopause and after as it seemed to help my (at times) serious depressions.  I only wish Medicare helped pay for it, as it's the only insurance I presently have. I could probably give up my Rx for Celexa if I had Estratest, but....o, well:(

column2: CST3, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I'M 54 YEARS OLD AND HAVE BEEN A VICTIM OF HOTFLUSHES, NIGHTSWEAT, IRRRITABILITY, AND MEMORY LOSS FOR 5YEARS.  I'VE BEEN TAKING THIS MED FOR 3 WEEKS AND I CAN ALREADY FEEL A REAL DIFFERENCE.

column2: Lorrie, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: judy, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: After removal of my ovaries,i had no sex drive,after taking this medication i have a enjoyable sex life once again. I worry because i understand this is not a drug to take for long periods of time.Risks?

column2: lo43, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I had a full hysterectomy, and after 3 years saw no decrease in the night sweats or hot flashes and had completely lost my sex drive.  I still have night sweats occasionally, but no more hot flashes or loss of libido.

column2: patroticsvs, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: Prior to taking this drug, I would have hot flashes and break out in a soaking sweat.  The full strength drug was too strong, which is why I take the HS version.  I have had a total hysterectomy and and this version of the drug has worked very well for me.  The hot flashes stopped, and I now show no signs of the change of life at all.

column2: patrioticsvs, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I was prescribed Estrate full strength but it turned out to be too strong.  Estratest works just fine.
